content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-225-02-B |Item_parent=Arteriopathy of the aorta, visceral arteries and lower limbs; aneurysms |Item_parent_short=Arteriopathy of the aorta, visceral arteries and lower limbs; aneurysms |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the aetiology and risk factors of AOMI |Description= |Rubric=Physiopathology |Contributors=Christian Boissier,Lucie Salomon Du Mont, Anne Long, Alessandra Bura, Patrick Feugier |Order=2}} AOMI is the local expression of a systemic disease, the prognosis of which is partly conditioned by cardiac complications (angina and myocardial infarction) and cerebrovascular complications. The ''risk factors'' for OSA are those for atheroma (Cf [[2C-221|221]]-[[2C-222|22]]2-[[2C-223|223]]-[[2C-224|224]]). - age, - Male sex - smoking, - diabetes, - HTA, - Hypercholesterolemia Obesity and a sedentary lifestyle Its '''prevention''' joins the '''prevention of cardiovascular disease.'''

question.question: Which of the following is NOT considered a risk factor for Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AOMI)?
